JobFullDesc:
You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back.

At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible — and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way. When you join #TeamAmex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day.

Function Description:

Growing consumer lending is a top priority for American Express, especially as the company mobilizes to capitalize on key growth opportunities. As a result, the Global Consumer Lending organization has been created to evolve our portfolio and transform the way we meet customer’s borrowing needs in an evolving landscape. The US Consumer Pricing team sits within Global Consumer Lending and plays a critical role in enabling the innovation and delivery of this vision. 

Purpose of the Role:

As a member of the US Consumer Pricing team, the Assistant Manager will be responsible for engaging customer lending growth through developing and executing analysis for the roadmap, vision, and long term strategy for American Express Customer Promotional Card Pricing, Pay It Plan It Promotional Pricing, and Pay Over Time Promotional Pricing. This position will work closely with key partners across various functions including Pricing, Product, Marketing, Finance, and Risk.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:



	Aid development of pricing strategies for American Express Customer Promotional Card Pricing, Pay It Plan It Promotional Pricing, and Pay Over-Time Promotional Pricing
	

	Analyze Customer data, portfolio trends and industry dynamics to gather customer insights, inform price testing strategy and devise recommendations to accelerate revenue growth
	

	Own pricing model and associated logic 
	

	Perform competitive benchmarking by leveraging quantitative and qualitative information
	

	Help prioritize projects by developing Cost Benefit Analysis
	

	Support execution processes
	

Qualifications:



	Ideal candidate will be leader with a passion for the customer, proven track record of driving results, and strong mix of skills in strategy and analytics.
	

	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to leverage large data sets to inform business decisions
	

	Ability to build strong inter-departmental relationships
	

	Excellent written and oral communication skills with strong attention to detail
	

	Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
	

	Understanding of credit card economics preferred, but not required
	

	Knowledge of SQL
	

	Bachelor's Degree or 2 years of work experience
